text: (1935 - April 3, 2020) was a Japanese engraver artist, photographer, and politician.Unless otherwise noted, biographical information is from the description of the Raika Dōmei exhibition "Hakata Yamadori" (Gallery 58, accessed 15 March 2009). He was born in Tokyo. His works used tin engravings. In both 1975 and 1979 ran in elections for Governor of Tokyo. From 1999 until 2003, Akiyama was a professor at Sapporo University. From 1992 until around 2009, Akiyama joined Genpei Akasegawa and Yutaka Takanashi in the informal group Raika Dōmei. Akiyama died on April 3, 2020 in Tokyo at the age of 85.「ポップ・ハプニング」美術家の秋山祐徳太子さん死去、８５歳 ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Artists from Tokyo Category:Japanese photographers Category:Politicians from Tokyo
title: Yūtokutaishi Akiyama
